titles.title: Expressing the sense of the Congress that Serbia-Montenegro has failed to comply with the Holbrooke-Milosevic agreement of October 13, 1998, and that the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) should implement its activation order of October 12, 1998, to compel compliance.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on International Relations.

term.name: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

bill.summary: 1/19/1999--Introduced. Expresses the sense of Congress that: (1) Serbia-Montenegro has failed to comply with the Holbrooke-Milosevic agreement of October 13, 1998, and other international obligations; and (2) the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) should implement its activation order of October 12, 1998, which authorizes and prepares alliance air forces to compel Serbia-Montenegro to comply with the Holbrooke-Milosevic agreement and other international obligations.
